clinical_study.brief_title: SUPPORT Online Training Platform for Type 1 Diabetes Self-management Education and Support (SUPPORT)
clinical_study.official_title: Optimizing Therapies and Technologies to Reduce Hypoglycemia in Type 1 Diabetes Through the SUPPORT Online Platform for Self-management Education and Support

collaborator.agency: Institut de Recherches Cliniques de Montreal

brief_summary.textblock: For people with type 1 diabetes (PWT1D), hypoglycemia limits the ability to manage diabetes and adopt optimal health behaviours. Possibly because of low level of confidence and low access to continuing medical education, there are evidences that some healthcare teams are not proposing new therapeutic and technology options that have the potential to reduce hypoglycemia for PWT1D. In practice, patients report receiving education related to insulin pumps usage mainly on key functions (how the device works) at initiation and not enough about proactive adjustments (how to optimally use the device) especially on the long-term. We observed that patients are reactive (e.g., correction insulin bolus or temporary basal suspension) to their data, rather than proactive (e.g., basal and bolus adjustments). In brief, short-term education is technical and product-specific, rather than being based on patients' needs.There is a need to test the efficacy of different program that may be more suited to patients' needs and desires while offering the opportunity to reduce costs (e.g. web based). Since there is a lack of expertise related to optimal use of new technologies and therapies for PWT1D, we propose to design an test a web-based training (e.g. courses including videos and quizzes) and support (e.g. forum) platform focusing on the reduction of hypoglycemia. This will be tested through a registry-based controlled trial. We hypothesize that our training and support program targeting optimization of new technologies and therapeutic options will reduce the frequency of hypoglycemia by 25% or the self-reported level of fear of hypoglycemia by 15% after 6 months compared to the baseline.

intervention.intervention_name: SUPPORT online platform for people with type 1 diabetes
intervention.description: This bilingual (English, French) training platform is accessible with an internet connection. Participants' learning is individualized depending on the way they take their insulin (injection or pump) and the way they measure their blood sugar (finger prick or continuous glucose monitoring). The training program starts with mandatory module on hypoglycemia. Once completed, participants will unlock all level 1 modules from the 6 categories (medication, blood sugar monitoring, nutrition, physical activity, hypo- and hyperglycemia, health and other situations). There are 3 levels of complexity. The platform contains functionalities such as reminder emails, discussion forum, quizzes, videos, downloadable forms, etc. Questionnaires will be sent by email (baseline, 6 months and 12 months) to collect information on hypoglycemia fear and frequency, diabetes knowledge, health literacy and platform evaluation and to include questions that are not included in the registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ≥ 18 years old
2. Completed phase 3 of the BETTER registry
3. Self-reported diagnosis of type 1 diabetes for ≥ 1 year
4. Daily use of ≥ 4 injections of insulin or CSII
5. Have the same diabetes treatment during the last 3 months
6. Have access to Internet
7. Use of an active email address
8. Comprehension of English or French
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Ongoing pregnancy
2. Other illnesses limiting diabetes care or access to the platform (e.g. dementia and blindness)
